metadata.debate_title: RedPill Debater CHALLENGES Destiny, EMBARRASES Himself And Privates VOD

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Don't worry, I'm here. I'm not going anywhere today. Hey there, Destiny, how are you?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Hey, pretty good. Were you talking about my school? Is that what was going on in here?

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: We're just warming up. We wanted to get some background on you because there was a funny thing going on on the internet. Your fanatics, they deluded themselves into thinking that you're brighter than you are. You see, because you have a history of debating internet personalities who probably similar to yourself lack experience and sophistication. And so now you're about to get exposed. And I said, you know, before we go in, let's take a little bit of background on who the guy is. And what we saw in your own bio, you're making excuses for why you didn't complete a basic degree, a very easy degree at a third-tier university.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Ring's moving slow. He's befuddled already. He's befuddled.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Yeah, okay, here, so just real quick, Chief. Okay, what kind of convo do you want to have here?

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Throw a lifeline.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Let's do two things. Number one, let's go through and start with a little bit of an interview so we can get familiar with you.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Yeah, go for it, okay.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: We'll share a couple questions, get familiar with you. And then we'll do the thing that you did on your stream, which is you played my content at length. So we'll play a couple of clips of yours and then we'll discuss it and react to it. And then if you want to get into any other political items, we can do that. But you'll notice that the title of this stream is twofold. Number one, it states that you're racist. And the funny thing is I almost never use this term. I think it's overused and mostly people are lying and they're using that as an excuse to explain why they personally are losers. But in your case, you exposed yourself. So we'll review that piece. And then there's a second thing you did, which is an abusive language. And I find it to be very disgusting and dangerous. And you use this term homophobia, which actually doesn't really exist in real life. It's something that the left often does. You guys like to create words. And then you like to instrumentalize words and also pseudoscience to achieve your ends. And so we're going to discuss this concept of homophobia. And then, you know, if you want to add on anything on the back end, oh, fantastic. How's that sound?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: It sounds good. I'm used to really emotional people lashing out, calling me racist. And I'm used to really emotional people being homophobic when they have nothing else to say. So wherever you want to go, we can go. We can go wherever you want. I'm curious on the school thing. Wait, so why do you think I quit school?

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: You wrote that you quit school and your website, let's confirm, your website is destiny.gg. Is that you?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: That's me.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Okay.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: And your website, it reads, quote, I went to the University of Nebraska at Omaha. And before we carry on, we're both clear that this is a third tier university. This is a very low ranking university, right?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: It's a state school in my state. I didn't have money to go to a private school.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Can we just keep it real and say that this is like shitville university? Can we just like not lie about that? Or are we going to pretend?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Well, no. So I would say to people that I highly recommend going to state schools if they serve the purpose that you have. I think it's really stupid.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Is this an illegal university?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Well, excuse me, sir. Let me finish my answer, right?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: I recommend people do state schools because why would I go to a university?

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Can we agree that it's a low tier university?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Yeah, it's a low tier university, but I'm going for a music degree. There's no point unless I'm going to Berkeley or Juilliard. It's not going to matter as long as the studio is good. It really doesn't matter what school you go to, right?

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: You understand that like a music performance degree from another state school doesn't matter. For music performance, the only thing that matters. That's why like, for example, Barack Obama went to Harvard. That helped him a great deal in pursuing the presidency.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Do you think that the school that you graduate from... Well, I'm just curious. Do you think the school you graduate from with a music performance degree, do you think that's going to mean anything when you go to apply for...

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Don't change the subject.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Well, no, no, I'm just, I'm asking you. I'm just, I just want to, I just want to hear it. Are we, wait, are we here to have a conversation and you're just trying to do a hit piece, dude?

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: One second, my dear boy. I just want to see if you're living on the planet Earth.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Well, no, no, and I'm trying to have a conversation with you, but you're just trying to do a hit piece. I'm not emotional at all, but I'm not going to sit here and let you like drag me around in the conversation if you don't have a real talk.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: It's okay to acknowledge that.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: It's going to be a boring talk.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Oh, it could be, it could be,

blocks.text: it could actually be entertaining and engaging too. Like we have the ability right now to have an interesting talk. I'm super calm right now, dude. I don't know if you know what it sounds like when somebody's excited, but this ain't it.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Calm down, calm down. Just relax real quick. I'm just asking you to find out if you're on planet Earth.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: I'm definitely on planet Earth. Yeah, for sure.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Say you asked me, you said Marquette, you went to, if I were you, you said Marquette, you went to University of Nebraska at Omaha. Is that a low tier university? I would say it absolutely is a low tier university. It's very clear by the rankings on US news and world report. It's clearly low tier. And I went there to save money or I went there because of this, but I wouldn't start giving long, verbose explanations because that's just an indicator of insecurity. And what's more, you shouldn't try to defend it because you didn't even get a degree. You dropped out. You're a college dropout. So just say that I dropped out. I couldn't, I couldn't hack it. That's, that's all I'm saying. So you don't have to get angry and defensive.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Okay, sure. So the actual answer is that like different universities are good for different purposes. For a music performance degree, as long as the studio is good, you go to the studio. In terms of overall rankings of university. Yeah, it's probably a really low ranked university. I wouldn't, it's the UNO. It wouldn't surprise me. Yeah, but I'm not going to pay out the ask to go to a state school or actually go to like a private school somewhere else. Yeah.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: But what's your, what's your, what's your, what's your, do you have any idea how insecure you have to be to look up the ranking of the school that I went to?

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: That's the longest, that's the longest possible explanation you could ever give to someone to say, can you agree that it's a university person?

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: All right, go for it. What's your, hit me up with your next question, dude.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Do a test to see if we're on planet earth together, but you, you're defensive and you're insecure.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Gotcha.

blocks.speaker: A

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Well, I'm not going to let you jerk me around in the conversation, right? Like what, what would be the,

blocks.text: please, please, please. No, not the sexual stuff. Come on, man. Like it's early. Yikes, bro.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: Dude, you think about other dudes dicks more than I do. That's really weird. But if that's like, if that's how you swing, bro, that's cool. I've seen a lot of homophobic people that secretly want to suck a dick. And if that's what you're after,

blocks.speaker: B

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: All right. Um, I actually did. And you're the first person to say anything that was homoerotic, but that's fine. That's fine. If that, if that eroticized, you might do that says way more about you than it does about me, but keep going.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Anyways, on your bio, on your website, it reads, I went to the university of Nebraska at Omaha and majored in music performance, but eventually dropped out due to conflict with work at the time. I feel like that's one of those things where I'm like, bro, like first off, if you didn't get a degree, there's no need to even list that. That's like me saying, like I went to the mall, walked in the Gucci store, and left. It's like, you didn't buy anything while you were there. That doesn't need to be a part of the narrative. It's almost like irrelevant.

blocks.speaker: A
blocks.text: Destiny.

blocks.speaker: B
blocks.text: That's a super easy. Yes or no question. Is my website LinkedIn? Is my website, is my website LinkedIn?

I wouldn't have like a long story. I just say, yes, that's correct. Or no, that's incorrect. So the question is why, when we're verifying yours, like you getting all defensive.

I didn't say I have a degree.
